oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Major Hilton Butler and Sergeant Alvin C. York

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Draft; Recruiting & enlistment; Soldiers; Government officials
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Butler, George Hilton, 1898-1970; Fentress County (Tenn.); World War, 1939-1945 -- Tennessee -- History; Selective Service System (U.S.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin C. York is talking with Major Hilton Butler at the Fentress County draft office at Jamestown. Both men are in business suits and are shown with paperwork, a stamp by a filing cabinet, and a 1940 calendar behind them.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During World War II, York served as Chairman of the Fentress County Draft Board, signed up with the Signal Corps and the Tennessee State Guard, and took part in bond tours, recruitment drives, and camp inspections. The Fentress County Draft Board consisted of York, Jess W. Evans, William H. Sewell, and William H. Voiles. Dr. J. P. Sloan was examining physician; George Hilton Butler was Director of Selective Service (1945-1947) and Tennessee Adjutant General (1945-1949).
